title: Google SERP crawler input
description: Define the Google search query using parameters below. You can scrape the data using specific language, country and location UUID.

queries.title: Queries or search URLs
queries.description: Enter here your queries or search URLs, one item per line.
queries.prefill:
Hotels in Prague
Restaurants in Prague
https://www.google.com/search?q=acoomodation&oq=acoomodation&aqs=chrome..69i57j0l5.1637j0j1&sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8

locationUule.title: Uule location code
locationUule.description: Enter [UULE](https://moz.com/ugc/geolocation-the-ultimate-tip-to-emulate-local-search) location code you want to use for geo spacious search results. This setting is not applied to search URLs entered above but only to text queries.

resultsNum.title: Results number per page
resultsNum.description: Enter how many results per page you want to query. Maximum is 100.

maxPagesPerQuery.title: Max pages per query
maxPagesPerQuery.description: Enter up to how many results pages you want to get for one query.

maxConcurrency.title: Max concurrency
maxConcurrency.description: Enter the maximum concurrency for this crawler. Higher number will give you results faster but will burn your available proxies faster on the other hand.

deviceType.title: Device type
deviceType.description: Select device type you want to use.

saveHtml.title: Save HTML
saveHtml.description: If checked then HTML of Google search results page will be stored in results.
